{"step_by_step_thinking": "Crouzon syndrome is a genetic disorder characterized by craniosynostosis, which is the premature fusion of cranial sutures. It is also associated with various craniofacial abnormalities. To determine which feature is not seen in Crouzon syndrome, we can review the information provided in the relevant documents. Document [7] states that Crouzon syndrome is characterized by craniosynostosis, maxillary hypoplasia, shallow orbits, ocular proptosis, and hypertelorism. Document [17] mentions that exophthalmos (bulging eyes) is a common feature. Document [20] describes Crouzon syndrome as having craniosynostosis, midfacial hypoplasia, and exophthalmos. Syndactyly.", "answer_choice": "B"}
